thread.title: MPs react with fury after Shami Chakrabarti misses weekly metting to go for drink with Diane Abbott
thread.title_full: MPs react with fury after Shami Chakrabarti misses weekly metting to go for drink with Diane Abbott

author: Laura Hughes
title: MPs react with fury after Shami Chakrabarti misses weekly metting to go for drink with Diane Abbott
text:
L abour MPs have reacted with fury after Shami Chakrabarti missed a weekly meeting of the parliamentary Labour Party to have a drink with Diane Abbott.
Jeremy Corbyn also declined an invitation to address MPs following the party's humiliating by-election defeat in Copeland last week . 
Key members of the shadow cabinet were missing from the gathering last night and were instead photographed in a House of Commons bar.
Labour MP Diane Abbott Credit: John Nguyen/JNVisuals B aroness Chakrabarti and Ms Abbott, the shadow home secretary, were pictured in the Pugin Room as Labour peers and MPs discussed the fallout from the two by-elections.
It came after she blamed factors including the media, public transport and the poor weather for the party's by-election performance in Copeland.
Graham Jones, Labour MP, said: "I am disappointed that it appears Shami and Diane were in the Pugin Room."
Watch | Jeremy Corbyn: 'I'm carrying on as leader' 00:21 S peaking after the meeting PLP meeting, he said: "She had a lot to say at the weekend. It's a shame she didn't have a lot to say in there.
"Perhaps if she had turned up she could have explained her comments. When it was revealed where she was, people felt it wasn't in order."
There was a "degree of frustration" about Lady Chakrabarti, the shadow attorney general, he said, because she was not elected and did not have to face the voters in the way MPs did.
Copeland by-election results
